data.neighbors.hubness

Class HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.neighbors.hubness.HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer

  • public class HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class helps with identifying how many points lie above or below a certain neighbor occurrence frequency threshold for various k values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer(int occurrenceThreshold, boolean selectAboveThreshold, NeighborSetFinder nsf)
      Initialization.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] getThresholdPercentageArray()
      This method calculates the percentage of points that lie above or below the specified occurrence threshold for each k value up until the maximum neighborhood size supported by the current calculations in the NeighborSetFinder object that was provided at initialization time.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer

        public HubnessAboveThresholdExplorer(int occurrenceThreshold,
                             boolean selectAboveThreshold,
                             NeighborSetFinder nsf)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        occurrenceThreshold - Integer that is the desired occurrence frequency threshold.
        selectAboveThreshold - Boolean flag indicating whether to count the points above or below the threshold.
        nsf - NeighborSetFinder object that holds the kNN sets that have been calculated beforehand.

    • Method Detail

      • getThresholdPercentageArray

        public float[] getThresholdPercentageArray()
        This method calculates the percentage of points that lie above or below the specified occurrence threshold for each k value up until the maximum neighborhood size supported by the current calculations in the NeighborSetFinder object that was provided at initialization time.
        Returns:
        float[] representing a series of percentages of points that lie either above or below the occurrence threshold (as specified in the constructor) for each k value from the supported k-range.
